intro: Pseudogynoxys guarumalensis, commonly known as the Guaramalén sunflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically showy blooms. The plant is herbaceous, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, making it a notable species for its ornamental value. Pseudogynoxys guarumalensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas.
